benchmark_details.name: Calibration through Semantic Perturbation (CSP)
benchmark_details.overview: CSP is a novel framework for training Vision-Language Models (VLMs) to improve object-level verbalized confidence calibration by simulating visual uncertainty through semantic perturbations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a framework that enhances the reliability and interpretability of VLMs through improved confidence calibration in response to object-centric queries.

data.source: Modified RLAIF dataset augmented with semantic perturbations for training.
data.annotation: Confidence labels assigned based on the level of visual noise introduced.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics calculated based on model predictions compared with ground truth from confidence-labeled samples.
methodology.interpretation: Increased accuracy and F1 Score indicate better calibration and task alignment, while lower ECE reflects improved confidence accuracy.
methodology.baseline_results: Models trained using CSP show accuracy improvements from 70.1% to 73.6% in AMBER.
methodology.validation: Extensive validation through experiments on benchmark datasets POPE and AMBER.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: MIT License for POPE and Apache License for AMBER.
